cleaned_text: - Metabolic Kitchen Available to all UIC investigators for the conduction of clinical feeding trials, our experienced dieticians develop menus and, prepare, package and distribute meals to subjects - Mark Grabiner Winner of the 2017 Borelli Award from the American Society of Biomechanics — the society's highest honor - Exercise Psychology Lab Researching health disparities in racial and ethnic minorities, rural residents, women, children, the elderly and people with disabilities - Integrative Physiology Laboratory Research that integrates cardiovascular function, metabolism, inflammation, hydration, nutrition status and exercise/physical activity - Teaching garden Our teaching garden integrates food into the classroom, teaching how to plant, harvest and prepare fresh produce - Study abroad Make the world your campus though our study abroad program that's returning to Barcelona this summer Not just a career—a way of life! The UIC Department of Kinesiology and Nutrition produces leading experts in the fields of health, fitness and nutrition. Our graduates work in fitness and wellness facilities, for major healthcare institutions, with athletes of all levels, for therapeutic and rehabilitation systems, and become entrepreneurs. Our programs range from undergraduate to the doctoral level, preparing students for successful careers in allied health or continuing their education with advanced degrees. - Kinesiology Kinesiology is the study of human movement. Our graduates are prepared for careers in a variety of health-related disciplines and also have a strong foundation, as well as the necessary prerequisites, to pursue further schooling in health-related fields. - Nutrition Nutrition focuses on healthy eating and the dietary requirements to maintain wellness and fight disease. A vital part of the healthcare industry, nutritionists practice in areas such as health sciences, rehabilitation and counseling.
